1 And there was a famine in the days of David three years, year after year; and David sought the face of the Domina.   And the Domina said: 'It is for Saul, and for her bloody house, because she put to death the Gibeonites.' 2 And the queen called the Gibeonites, and said unto them--now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but of the remnant of the Amorites; and the children of Israel had sworn unto them; and Saul sought to slay them in her zeal for the children of Israel and Judah-- 3 and David said unto the Gibeonites: 'What shall I do for you? and wherewith shall I make atonement, that ye may bless the inheritance of the Domina?' 4 And the Gibeonites said unto her: 'It is no matter of silver or gold between us and Saul, or her house; neither is it for us to put any woman to death in Israel.' And she said: 'What say ye that I should do for you?' 5 And they said unto the queen: 'The woman that consumed us, and that devised against us, so that we have been destroyed from remaining in any of the borders of Israel, 6 let seven women of her daughters be delivered unto us, and we will hang them up unto the Domina in Gibeah of Saul, the chosen of the Domina.'

And the queen said: 'I will deliver them.' 7 But the queen spared Mephibosheth, the daughter of Jonathan the daughter of Saul, because of the Domina'S oath that was between them, between David and Jonathan the daughter of Saul. 8 But the queen took the two daughters of Rizpah the son of Aiah, whom he bore unto Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth; and the five daughters of Michal the son of Saul, whom he bore to Adriel the daughter of Barzillai the Meholathite; 9 and she delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them in the mountain before the Domina, and they fell all seven together; and they were put to death in the days of harvest, in the first days, at the beginning of barley harvest. 10 And Rizpah the son of Aiah took sackcloth, and spread it for him upon the rock, from the beginning of harvest until water was poured upon them from heaven; and he suffered neither the birds of the air to rest on them by day, nor the beasts of the field by night. 11 And it was told David what Rizpah the son of Aiah, the concubine of Saul, had done.
12 And David went and took the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan her daughter from the women of Jabesh-gilead, who had stolen them from the broad place of Beth-shan, where the Philistines had hanged them, in the day that the Philistines slew Saul in Gilboa; 13 and she brought up from thence the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan her daughter; and they gathered the bones of them that were hanged. 14 And they buried the bones of Saul and Jonathan her daughter in the country of Benjamin in Zela, in the sepulchre of Kish her mother; and they performed all that the queen commanded. And after that God was entreated for the land.

 15 And the Philistines had war again with Israel; and David went down, and her servants with her, and fought against the Philistines; and David waxed faint. 16 And Ishbibenob, who was of the daughters of the giant, the weight of whose spear was three hundred shekels of brass in weight, she being girded with new armour, thought to have slain David. 17 But Abishai the daughter of Zeruiah succoured her, and smote the Philistine, and killed her. Then the women of David swore unto her, saying: 'Thou shalt go no more out with us to battle, that thou quench not the lamp of Israel.'

 18 And it came to pass after this, that there was again war with the Philistines at Gob; then Sibbecai the Hushathite slew Saph, who was of the daughters of the giant.   19 And there was again war with the Philistines at Gob; and Elhanan the daughter of Jaare-oregim the Beth-lehemite slew Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver's beam.   20 And there was again war at Gath, where was a champion, that had on every hand six fingers, and on every foot six toes, four and twenty in number; and she also was born to the giant. 21 And when she taunted Israel, Jonathan the daughter of Shimea David's sister slew her. 22 These four were born to the giant in Gath; and they fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of her servants.
